resources.string: \nCrossedPaths is an app platform for secure and anonymous location overlap sharing by interested groups. If you are interested in setting up your own group, please use envelope icon on the main screen to contact us.\n

CHECK DATABASE shows you the location overlaps you have with other group members in the location and time duration setup by your group. It also shows you a short message/explanation from the group\'s administrator. \n
Once you are satisfied with CrossedPaths\'s data privacy and would like to see it adopted to benefit private or public affairs, please share with a friend or government official.

Data privacy is a natural concern for location sharing apps. CrossedPaths prioritizes data privacy employing multiple strategies:

1. All data is stored locally on your phone. No one, not even other apps on your phone, can access it. Sharing data with any group administrator is voluntary. It is your responsibility to read the privacy policy of that group which is provided everytime when you send data.

2. You have complete control over when to collect data. Data is automatically deleted after a week. You can delete all data at any time.

3. The digital signature of your location history instead of your actual location history is stored locally on your phone. These signatures cannot be traced back to origin location and time and can only be compared to on another to check if they match.

4. Decentralized model lets your phone download the database and compare on the phone. No one else knows your overlap results.

5. Only digital signatures of timestamped locations that fit the group adminstrator's description are sent to that administrator. We require the administrator clearly specify the specific locations and times that they collect in their privacy policy. Through programming, we implement these exact descriptions

6. If you still have reservations on data privacy, a path you can take is to start updating location only when you anticipate meeting group members that do not live with you, such as going to work or out shopping. At other times, you can turn off the location updates.

7. You are not allowed to share your digital signatures collected following one group's description to another group, so you will not accidentally share data to the wrong group.

8. In rare occasions, we or a third party working with us may ask you to voluntarily share all your digital signatures in the past 7 days. More privacy protocols will be communicated to you at that time. A password will be provided to enable you to share those infomration if you choose.
Once satisfied with its data privacy, please share CrossedPaths with friends. If you think such app can benefit public affairs in Michigan, please email Governor Whitmer by pressing the icon below.
You selected other... Press to update groups.

Warning: You are sending digital tokens of your location history to CrossedPaths. We discourage this choice and use password protection to prevent accidental sending. If you insist on sending digital token to CrossedPaths, please contact us first to get the password.
Your selected group is passoword protected, please enter correct password to join.

Effective as of July 18, 2020.

"Privacy Policy" describes the privacy practices of CrossedPaths Foundation ("CrossedPaths," "we," "us," or "our") in connection with the CrossedPaths GPS mobile application (“app”). This Privacy Policy also describes the rights and choices available to individuals with respect to their information when using the app. 

ABOUT CROSSEDPATHS

CrossedPaths GPS is an app that provides a platform for users to be voluntarily notified of important information based on their location history without sacrificing privacy for the ones who share the information. For example, a store may want to unintrusively promote a product to all people who visited the stores in the recent past. Another example is person A that visted a restaurant may like to be volunteerily contacted by person B who were close at the restaurant at the same time. Our app provides a platform that may make such desires possible.

HOW CROSSEDPATHS WORKS

Timestamped location is always one-way hashed into a string that serves as the digital signature of that particular time-space before it is stored. "One-way" means that it's nearly impossible to derive the original text from the string, thus making it nearly impossible to reverse a digital signature to reveal the original time-space. However, this signature can be used to compare to signuatures in another user's phone. Equal signuatures indicate overlaps of time-space between the two devices. A user choose when to track the device's location using such digital signatures that become stored on the device for 7 days. A copy of these data signatures that fit a group's location and time specification that the user wants to be associated with is also saved on the device for 7 days. This copy can be later shared with the group's administrator at the user's discretion. Working with us, a group administrator can setup a group specifying the time-space range of digital signatures that the group is interested. Each group provides its own privacy policy specifying how they will use the collected data. Users agreeing with a group's privacy policy can voluntarily send digital signatures that satisfy the group time-space specification to the group administrator. After removing all identifiable information, the group administrator can publish the shared digital signaturs in an anonymous, aggregated, or de-identified data set where other users can download to compare to their digital signatures on their devices. The only information can be derived for end-user is how many overlaps the device had with the data signatures in the data set. No information about who, where, or how long each overlap lasts can be gained. The group administrator can also show a specific message giving context to "overlaps" when an end user choose to download from the group's data set.

USER RESPONSIBILITIES

CrossedPaths GPS is designed to facilitate anonymous sharing of digital signatures of location history. As such, it is imperative that you: (i) comply with our terms of use; (ii) provide accurate information (including location data) when using the app; and (iii) make informed decisions about how you use CrossedPaths including a group's own privacy policy before your decision to share any digital signatures with that group's administrator.

PERSONAL INFORMATION WE COLLECT

Information you provide to us.
The personal information you provide to us through CrossedPaths GPS or otherwise may include:
 •Your email address if you contact us through email, and any information you disclose in emails you sent us.
 •We do not collect digital signatures of time stamped location from you. If you choose to share these digital signatures with a group's administrator, please follow that group's privacy policy whose link is provided prominently above the email button to send data to the group's administrator.

HOW WE USE YOUR PERSONAL INFORMATION

We may use your personal information for the following purposes and as otherwise described in this Privacy Policy or at the time of collection:
To operate the Service. We may use your personal information to:
 •if you share digital signatures with us, the shared digital signatures are merged into an annoymous, aggregated, or de-identified data set to publish to other end users. Once that is done, all personal information including your email address is immediately deleted.
 •if you contacted us, we may use your email address to respond to your requests, questions, and feedback.
To comply with the law. We may use your personal information as we believe necessary or appropriate to comply with applicable laws, lawful requests, and legal processes, such as to respond to subpoenas or requests from government authorities.
For compliance, fraud prevention, and safety. We may use your personal information and disclose it to law enforcement, government authorities, and private parties as we believe necessary or appropriate to: (a) protect our, your or others' rights, privacy, safety or property (including by making and defending legal claims); (b) enforce the terms and conditions that govern the app; and (c) protect, investigate and deter against fraudulent, harmful, unauthorized, unethical or illegal activity.
To create anonymous, aggregated, or de-identified data. We may create anonymous, aggregated, or de-identified data from your shared digital signatures of location history and other individuals digital signatures. We make personal information into anonymous, aggregated, or de-identified data by removing information that makes the data personally identifiable to you. We may use this anonymous, aggregated, or de-identified data and share it with third parties, our Partners, or others for our lawful business purposes.
 With your consent. In some cases, we may specifically ask for your consent to collect, use, or share your personal information, such as when required by law.

HOW WE SHARE YOUR PERSONAL INFORMATION

We use digital signatures of the location history you share with us to create anonymous, aggregated, or de-identified data. We only share the final anonymous, aggregated, or de-identified data with third parties. Other CrossedPaths GPS Users. We will alert users who were within nearby proximity of a sharing user during the preceding 7 days. While this information does not directly identify you, there are circumstances when a user could identify you if the user only meets very few people during these days. For example, this may occur if a user met you and others that the user can be certain others did not share their digital signatures during the 7 days.
Professional advisors. If you contact us other than to share digital signatures of your location history, we may disclose your personal information in those contacts to professional advisors, such as lawyers, auditors, and insurers, where necessary in the course of the professional services that they render to us.
 For compliance, fraud prevention and safety. We may share your personal information for the compliance, fraud prevention and safety purposes described above. We will not proactively share your personal information with the government without your consent.
Business transfers. We may sell, transfer or otherwise share some or all of our business or assets, in connection with a business transaction (or potential business transaction) such as a merger, consolidation, acquisition, reorganization or sale of assets, or in the event of bankruptcy or dissolution. 

YOUR CHOICES

In this section, we describe the rights and choices available to all users. Your use of the CrossedPaths GPS is voluntary. You can request you shared digital signatures removed by sending those digital signatures again and an instruction to remove as the title. After 7 days, all information is deleted. Privacy settings and location data. We make available certain privacy settings on the app, including options to control your sharing of digital signatures of your location history. Users of our mobile application also have the choice of whether to allow us to access your precise location data. After you allow access, you have the choice when to track your location history and when to stop. You also have the option to delete all the data we collected on your phone completely. Your device settings may provide the ability for you to revoke our ability to access location data. CrossedPaths GPS will not function as a means for detecting location overlap and information sharing if you do not allow access to your location data. Do Not Track. Some Internet browsers may be configured to send "Do Not Track" signals to the online services that you visit. We currently do not respond to "Do Not Track" or similar signals. To find out more about "Do Not Track," please visit http://www.allaboutdnt.com.
Choosing not to share your personal information. Where we are required by law to collect your personal information, or where we need your personal information in order to provide the Service to you, if you do not provide this information when requested (or you later ask to delete it), we may not be able to provide you with our services. We will tell you what information you must provide to receive our Service by designating it as required at the time of collection or through other appropriate means.

OTHER SITES, MOBILE APPLICATION, AND SERVICES

The apps may contain links to other websites, mobile applications, and other online services operated by third parties. These links are not an endorsement of, or representation that we are affiliated with, any third party. In addition, our content may be included on web pages or in mobile applications or online services that are not associated with us. We do not control third-party websites, mobile applications, or online services, and we are not responsible for their actions. Other websites and services follow different rules regarding the collection, use, and sharing of your personal information. We encourage you to read the privacy policies of the other websites and mobile applications and online services you use.

SECURITY PRACTICES

The security of your personal information is important to us. We employ a number of organizational, technical and physical safeguards designed to protect the personal information we collect. However, the security risk is inherent in all internet and information technologies, and we cannot guarantee the security of your personal information.
 

INTERNATIONAL DATA TRANSFERS

We are headquartered in the United States and currently have no service providers in other countries. Your personal information remains in the United States.

CHILDREN

As a general rule, children under the age of 12 years old are not allowed to use the app, and we do not collect personal information from them. We encourage parents with concerns to contact us. Children between 12 and 16 years old must have their parent's permission to use this app. 

CHANGES TO THIS PRIVACY POLICY

We reserve the right to modify this Privacy Policy at any time. If we make material changes to this Privacy Policy, we will notify you by updating the date of this Privacy Policy and posting it on a new version of the app.
Any modifications to this Privacy Policy will be effective upon our posting the new terms and/or upon implementation of the new changes on the app (or as otherwise indicated at the time of posting). In all cases, your continued use of the app after the posting of any modified Privacy Policy indicates your acceptance of the terms of the modified Privacy Policy.

HOW TO CONTACT US

Please direct any questions or comments about this Policy or privacy practices to havewemetapp@gmail.com.
